intro: Rudbeckia mollis, commonly known as the softleaf coneflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy yellow to orange ray florets surrounding a prominent, dark brown central disk. The plant has soft, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue. It typically grows to a height of 2 to 3 feet and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Rudbeckia mollis is valued in gardens for its attractive flowers and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
